title: Very good experience
body: Exceptional doctor and nurse,both were caring and understanding my symptoms . They took time to listen to me with compassion and advise me well left much happier.thank you

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely practice
body: Great service. Efficient and very friendly staff. Very accommodating and ensured privacy at all times. Keeping me informed

title: Qualitative Care Support
body: Hi, with all due respect I'm writing just to say big  thanks to all Management of staff at Lawrence Hill health centre for their Qualitative care support services within the Neibour hood. For over20yrs, I've never regret a second been a patient because all the Management team delivered excellent care services whenever it's needed. in fact Anytime,Anyday, I vist my present GP he listened and digest my health issues by giving me a body M.o.t and Re-assurance rest of mind on my health worries Many Thks, kind regards. But pls note,,The time given on appointments to see a GP should be Reduced

title: Useless waste of tax payers money
body: Ineffective reception staff tool information in correctly- appalling service from treating practitioners  unable to explain circumstances/need.  Required stitches out told 4 to 6 hour wait and make an appointment.  Advised stitches need to come out in 6 days  told you will have to wait for appointment- attitude appalling manner appalling.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Curious
body: This morning (19th July 2023) I had a physiotherapy appointment. It was my first appointment for back and hip pain. The session lasted 45 minutes. The physiotherapist was excellent - thorough, professional and caring. However, the first 15 minutes were taken up with questions and answers about my current symptoms, my medical history and my medications. All of these are, or should be, on my medical record. Is this not a great waste of NHS time?

title: Awful
body:
Absolutely disgusting attitude ...especially by the receptionists who clearly have no idea that if a patient  calls up asking to see the doctor ( I've been with this practice 20+ years btw) it doesn't give them reason to play god or talk down to us as if we are children.
I called up asking to see a doctor.
Reception said you can have a triage appt. Fair enough...filled in the form reqd...2 weeks later still waiting.
Called them again.
Reception said she's added name on doctors list so you will get a call tomoz.
Guess what?
No phone call. 
Called again.
She said fill in form that gets sent to you and he will call.
Once again no phone call.
Called again .
Reception said you can have a appt tomoz at 8.30 in morning. 
I explained its not possible due to work....could you give me a appt at any evening any  day after 4pm.
Not possible  was the reply.
I asked what time its open till?
6.30 but that time after 4 is for admin.
Unbelievable 
Then I found out it wouldn't be the doctor...it would be the nurse I woukd see.

Atrocious arrogant ignorant staff.

I will join another practice.

title: Worst Receptionists ever met
body: It is always a battle with these appalling reception staff. They are rude, dismissive and impatient. When you ask for a doctors appointment they ask numerous personal questions why. Then decide "in their judgement " you can go to the chemist instead. The chemist then says no, you need the doctor. They are more interested in their own conversations than helping people & make you feel like a time waster. Manners & courtesy here are long gone, replaced by patronising arrogance. When you do insist, and see the doctors,  they are lovely and so helpful.  The staff need urgent training,  starting with manners

title: No service available at this surgery & long waite…
body: Getting through the surgery is impossible without a long wait  every day. The longest I have been in queue for is 1hour and 20mins, but when the phone is finally answered, I get told to call back the next morning as appointments are not available to be booked. For the past month, I have been trying to book a routine appointment and it’s impossible. Why can’t I book appointments in the future like I used to be able to? Waiting for a new system, what kind of excuse is that you are putting patients' health at risk, been told with new system can only book in one day’s advance how will  patience get the time off work to see a gp next day just seems this surgery don’t care about it’s patients at all, even urgent appointments are unavailable and they tell you to go walk in honestly avoid this surge don’t waste your time registering with them because at the end when you need to see a gp they won’t offer you any appointments no matter how desperate or ill you are. Duty of care is just not being met by Goldsworth worth medical practice.

title: Diabolical
body: At a time of stress when you need help this service is appalling, not fit for purpose and seriously failing Cambridge’s young people and their families. Mental health services need a very serious overhaul. What should be a simple process, is incompetent and disjointed and lacking any compassion or sense of urgency.

author: puppisps35
title: Tongue Tie
body:
I breastfed my baby from birth but had feeding issues with latch which made it painful for me and difficult for my baby. Baby seemed hungry as was unsettled a lot too, so wasn't getting what they needed from me.  
A tongue tie was noticed by midwife when baby was just 4 days old. I had a visit from infant feeding team the next day and so midwife said they would be able to help. At this visit baby had lost 6% of birth weight. The feeding team said they could do nothing for a tongue tie unless referred. They helped with position but this was not solving the real issue.  
Midwife then referred for tongue tie when baby was over a week old. Infant feeding spoke with me the next day to explain there had to be a further 3 visits from feeding team before we would be invited to clinic for tongue tie assessment. My baby had since lost even more weight, almost a whole pound under birth weight. I was also in a lot of pain after 2 bouts of mastitis and exhausted from next to no sleep due to baby not settling at all.  
The news that we had to wait even more time began to impact my mental health as I was worried my baby would continue to lose weight and I was feeling so unwell. It was recommended I top up with formula and express, this became even more of a burden on top of an already stressful feeding experience.  
After 2 weeks breastfeeding, I gave up and switched baby to formula. We have since had tongue tie divided privately and feeding is now improved with baby gaining weight and content. I am very lucky I was able to take baby to be seen privately, not everyone can. I also believe that I could have continued to breastfeed had the tongue tie been taken more seriously and dealt with quickly. It is likely a lot of women give up breastfeeding prematurely as a result of this.  
I feel that more training is required in this area so more staff are able to adequately diagnose tongue tie and perform the division procedure. It would help a lot of women and babies in their feeding journeys and reduce unnecessary stress at what should be a joyous time.

title: Prescription review
body: The pharmacist was detailed in her questioning and supportive with follow up questions. She advised some future actions.

title: Uncaring nurse in S Tech Ward
body: I am a volunteer driver based in Towcester. I took a cancer patient to Towcester Medical Centre this morning. The nurse there informed me the patient is vert unwell and needs transferring to Northants hospital S Tech ward as she was very dehydrated. As an ambulance would be too long in coming, I was asked to take her. I did this and having consulted a nurse in A & E was told to take the patient straight to S Tech ward. When I arrived there, a nurse informed me I was in the wrong place and told that Towcester Medical Centre had no followed protocol. I said the patient is very ill. The nurse then said, and I quote. It's not my problem, take her back to A & E, I am busy with another problem.

title: Shockingly terrible (lack of) mental health care
body: Will call you out of nowhere from No Caller ID without leaving a voicemail and then discharge you because you didn't engage with the service (when you didn't even know they'd rang), will patronise you during assessments, will raise their voice at you if you ask any questions, will refuse to listen to you. Trust me, this whole dialog+ "putting patients in control of their treatment" thing is an absolute lie, you won't once be asked for your input or opinion on your condition or your treatment. You will be constantly spoken down to, shouted at, sighed at, and ignored (seriously good luck trying to get into contact with these people, no one answers the phone or emails and if they do they're unhelpful and rude, but god forbid you miss a caller ID withheld phone call, you'll be discharged). This was all my experience with Barnet North Core team, it has made me more unwell and stressed. It's a shame mental health care is a postcode lottery, and if you live in Barnet, you've lost.

title: Can I get my prescription?
body: Prescriptions are not for fun. I need my medication. Week after week I come in to the surgery, I fill in the forms, I phone the surgery, I check with the pharmacy...no prescription! The number of times I have been told it has been lost. Today I am out of my medication and the prescription is supposed to be with the pharmacy today, but, no prescription! And Wednesday is surgery training day, I have  no way to contact the surgery to ask what has happened to my medication. Prescriptions are not for fun, they are needed medication. When the surgery fails to provide the prescription it causes complications for the patient. Please resolve the constant problems with creating and delivering prescriptions.

title: Always try their best
body:
I've been with Downlands all my life and I am 34. The staff are always trying their best to service their patients but unfortunately a lot of bad reviews are for reasons that they cannot control. They are simply too busy for the amount of people that they have to serve, and get seemly no help from the government in sorting out this problem. Their solution is to build more houses....

In spite of this the GPs are always friendly and the poor reception staff are always as helpful as they can be despite often not being able to do much because they have too many patients. The practise manager is always happy to discuss issues with the patients and they will always point you in the best direction for getting help.

title: Shocking
body:
I telephoned The Gables this morning and there is a new phone system to progress through. There are several options to press a numbered button on your phone keypad, or else to continue to hold, as I did because I have no idea which of the options I am classified as. After several attempts somebody 
answered my call. I said who I needed to talk to and I was asked my reason for calling, so an email could be sent to the person concerned. I did this and was informed that I would be contacted later. 
I was indeed contacted and after speaking about my problem, the call was wound up. I felt no further forward with my issue, and I wasn’t even asked how I was. The call must have only lasted 2 minutes. 
This is no surprise to me, as I find there is a contrived nature to all my dealings with this place. I might just as well go talk to a robot then at least I would know I was not dealing with a person!
I know there is a chronic lack of funding for mental health, but it would help if I could speak to a human being who has at least got some empathy and interest in how I feel. Today I really needed to talk, but it didn’t happen.

readBy.name: Essex Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant Surgery & Great Experience
body: I attended the practice on 4th July & 18 July 2023 and need to point out that the surgery has improved unbelievably. The reception team and clinical team have changed in the most fabulous way. The new manager has also been extremely helpful and understanding in all ways and has made my experience at the practice fantastic along with the reception and clinical team.

title: Appointments
body:
Having been advised by a locum Dr at the Arlesey Health Centre to book a GP appointment I have been trying for the last three mornings to do so at Larksfield and also a visit to the surgery trying to get an appointment   It is an impossible situation and very frustrating for patients when trying to follow GPs advice   



GP appointment I have been trying for the last three days to book one at Larksfield.

author: jeawq57
title: We'll never forget them.
body:
We're on holiday and my husband has received care from the Hospital at home care team. How do we begin to describe this wonderful team?  
We are so grateful for their care.  
Every one of the team has been excellent. They went above and beyond for us in every way.  
We'll never forget them.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Good practice
body: Visited surgery yesterday saw a lady paramedic who treated me extremely well and then referred herself to a Doctor to discuss my case and texted me later with the diagnosis that they both agreed on. Then this morning 19th July I received a call from a Doctor who talked me through what was best for me to do next and put he also put my mind at rest and felt much better after the talk with him . So I was very happy with the service I received from my Surgery.

title: Absolute shambles
body: I was on hold for 1:20 this afternoon, surgery has closed for the afternoon for training, no notice anywhere but in the surgery itself which I only found out later after having to go in to try and resolve an issue. It’s appalling, been passed from pillar to post regarding tests and retests, no one seems to have any idea what’s going on. Just go round in circles, like I said, absolute shambles of a place, everything’s automated I feel sorry for older people who struggle with technology, basically just cutting old people off.

title: No service. It's closed. Basically
body: They told me they get 50 calls every morning from patients wanting to be seen and half can't be seen, yet the place is "currently taking on new patients". They absolutely cannot handle the number of patients they have so I'm assuming there must be some sort of bonus for signing up new patients because this place is clearly about making money not for helping people. The place is empty when you actually get to go there but you can only get an appointment if you go through 111. I know Friargate surgery is even worse so what choice do you have? Die on hold....

title: Unhelpful
body: I rang to request a blood form as advised by lipid clinic,  receptionist refused to ask GP for blood test as letter omitted to say one was needed, essentially saying I was making it up so would have to waste a GP appt to discuss. An appt wasn’t necessary but receptionist wasn’t even prepared to ask GP. Such a waste of everybody’s time for something so simple

title: Worst experience
body: The waiting time is atleast an hour in the morning 8 to10 am(when it is usually urgent). I was in acute pain, the doctor prescribed me the medicine in the morning and i then understand that it has not been signed by the doctor and the medicine can be collected from pharmacy only after 5pm. In an urgent situation and acute pain, so the entire day i need to wait for the medicine.

title: Inaccurate posted opening times
body:
NHS Website and notice on surgery door says the practice is open on Wednesdays: 0830 to 1830.
Not so today - several people in the car park finding it closed

title: Friendly Doctors
body:
My family have been patients at this practice for over thirty years. Overall the service of the doctors is excellent. The doctors take time to listen help where they can. They have also come on home visits.  One named GP also rings to check on elderly family members. However the system for booking appointments is not patient friendly. I don't understand why the system is not open all the time. Surely it is known when the doctors work and when they are on leave. Having been told to keep ringing or going in every two weeks only  to find that all the appointments have gone. Last year I waited five weeks for an appt but at least I knew I was going to see my doctor. This year I have yet to get an appointment. We are always told get it checked by a doctor, that it seems is easier said than done.
It's a shame as it lets the the health centre down.

title: Superb care
body: The staff on Dorrel ward are magnificent.   Everything was explained to me in detail about my treatment.   I stayed overnight and the doctors, nurses and other staff were wonderful , caring, thoughtful and helpful .  Nothing was too much trouble .     It’s just such a shame that I had to wait in A and E for 8 hours before being admitted.

title: Terrible communication
body: I called at 08.00 hrs on Thursday 13/07/2023 wanting to speak to a GP about an ongoing problem and see where I need to go with the problem, referral, steroid etc. I was told someone would call me later but of course they cannot give you a time not even an approximate time. Lo and behold no phone call !! Instead I received a call from the nurse and I told her it was a doctor I needed to speak to because of the reasons outlined earlier. She apologised and said she would speak to the receptionists. Still no phone call and my wife and I have lost count of calls that have not been made. Appalling service and no 'duty of care' as Far as I can see. Seriously thinking of changing surgeries !!

title: Dreadful
body: I phoned hazeldene surgery out of desperation due to my B/P rising above 203/82. I was told to visit the surgery to pick a blood pressure record sheet and write my B/P readings morning and night and return the completed form in a week's time.I really couldn't believe what I was Hearing So in desperation I had to call 111 who dispatched an ambulance and I was checked over and the lovely ambulance staff insisted I go immediately the county hospital who gave me 2cardiograms and I was later discharged after my blood pressure had been reduced to a safe reading.I have found it virtually impossible to see a doctor in person.i have had to go private previously because I couldn't get to see a doctor

author: librarp96
title: Sexual health support
body:
I've had 2 shots off penicillin since my rashes have gotten worse. So I've been to the walk in twice and just been told you have had the right dosage and I have to wait until the end of August for my 3 months blood test.  
The first time I went a doctor looked at my penis and said I had eczema and go to the GP. They were obviously wrong. 3 months later a GP said I should go back. I've mentioned this since to two doctors. Surly my rashes shouldn't be getting worse? I'm unsure as nothing seems to be explained to the patient.  
After being given my penicillin I was told you're cured now. I've had enough of living.  
I've talked to someone at the clinic who is helping by asking me to come back in .  
Thanks

author: Cols12
title: An absolutely amazing nurse
body:
We recently had a bereavement in our family & we would like to pay thanks to the district nurses who attended our loved family member.  
Quayside district nursing team were fantastic over the course of the illness, but particularly this message is to show appreciation for the weekend cover we had from district nurse Orla.  
She entered our home with such dignity and manners, nothing was too much trouble. She managed our relatives distress along side ours and provided the much needed comfort.  
I have never met someone with so much caring skills. I am 100 percent sure our relative wouldn’t have had the peaceful death without her. We will be forever in debt for Orla that weekend. An absolutely amazing nurse  
Thank you from us all .

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Can never get through…
body:
19th July: called doctors around 1pm I was number 7 in the queue. It took me over 45 minutes to get to number 5 in the queue 
2nd attempt at trying to get through was at 17:10 I got to be caller number one after 10 minutes only to be cut off
….. still trying to get through!

title: Poor Communication
body:
I have today, 19th July, received a letter dated 22nd June confirming my appointment on 4th July
The letter highlights in bold that I may have drops, which I did, and that I should not drive.  Why could this important info not have been given to me before. Fortunately I did not drive
You must get your act together better than this!

title: The worst
body: Ages to get thru on phone. Old message relating to last winter. GP never calls back. Virtually impossible to get an appointment unless you're dying. So very unhelpful. I really need to move practice.

author: Stockport mum
title: Early days group
body:
I just wanted to say how much I enjoyed the early days group that I attended in Heaton Norris recently. My daughter and I attended all 4 classes with Zoe and Lynne.  
They were both so friendly and welcoming, and I found the classes really useful.  
Thank you!

title: inefficient practice
body: Having told Kings that I did not want to be referred to a particular ineffective outside healthcare agency GP, they referred me again. He was unhelpful and unfriendly. Whats more. I can't find any qualifications for him.

author: Leo96
title: The whole experience was terrible from start to finish
body:
During my stay I was made to feel uncomfortable, not listened to and mentally and physically exhausted. I was Nil by Mouth for just over 2 days. During this time I had no IV fluids to keep me hydrated. Another patients faeces was left in a bed pan in the shared bathroom uncovered for over 12 hours. After multiple patients asked for this to be moved by nursing and HCA staff members, this was finally disposed of by another patient who got sick of the smell and having to see this when going to the toilet.  
I was then moved to another ward. I wasn't told I was allowed to eat and drink but was then chastised by staff for 'refusing' when I wasn't told I could now eat and drink as normal. Another elderly patient in the bay who clearly was confused and delirious was shouting all night, screaming for help and nurses but was ignored. At one point mulitple patients buzzed for the nurse as the elderly patient's call button was moved out of their reach to advise that the patient had soiled herself. She was left wet and soiled for 2 hours.  
None of the patients got any sleep during the stay as we were told to get up in the morning and move around we couldn't sleep all day as that wouldn't help us get better. After being told I needed a catheter the nurse tried multiple times to insert this and after not being able to do so told me I could try do this myself or go without. When I said I had had multiple catheters before and had no issues having them put in I was told my genitalia wasn't normal and didn't look like others they had put catheters in before which is why they couldn't do it, which I found wholly unacceptable. I sat and cried after that feeling ashamed and embarrassed. This particular nurse upset another patient with a similar comment resulting in her removing her own IV and attempting to leave in the early hours of the morning.  
My symptoms and pain was not listened to. I was made to feel small and like an inconvenience. When being taken for a scan a HCA sat scrolling social media on her phone whilst we waited, texted friends and speaking about weekend plans. I'm not sure if they thought this was acceptable due to us being a similar age but it was not what I wanted to hear at 2:00am having been woken up and taken for a scan.  
The whole experience was terrible from start to finish. After being discharged I queried my medications as there were some the Dr told me I would need to take not included in the prescription. After much argument this was resolved but shouldn't have been such an argument to get medication which was on my discharge paperwork. I offered to go to the pharmacy myself to collect this but was told no.  
I didn't not feel well enough to come home on discharge. I was still in significant pain, vomiting and unwell but made the decision that being at home and able to sleep, shower and eat properly would be better for myself than being in the hospital. The ward was dirty, staff didn't have name badges on, nurses would openly talk about and slag off patients within ear shot of the patients they were talking about to other staff and even other patients. Something needs to change - if the nurses don't want to be there and actually care about their patients mental and physical wellbeing then I think they should consider another career path.

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Womens Health from nurse
body:
The nurse was amazing, she listened to my menopause journey during my smear test appointment and offered to arrange blood test and gave advice.
Provided an alternative strategy to what was on my notes to improve comfort during my smear test and it worked .
Thank you for this brilliant service

title: Excellent Care
body:
My Mum was admitted to hospital on 2 July and discharged on 19 July following treatment relating to a suspected heart issue and gall bladder and urinary infections. She was initially in A&E/AAU and then moved to Ward 4 and then Ward 17. The care she has received from the teams in all of these areas has been exemplary. I cannot say thank you enough as having such a poorly 90 year old Mum was a big worry. Everything went so smoothly and Mum was looked after so well and it has been a huge comfort to the family knowing that she was in such safe hands.
We are so lucky to have our wonderful NHS. Thank you.

author: eaglewt96
title: Face to Face appointment
body:
Today I met Dr Kaminskiene a cardiologist to discuss the results of my Echo test and my general condition and other illnesses. The Echo results showed no change, which was a relief.  
When discussing my general conditions Dr Kaminskiene showed great interest and understanding in a very friendly and compassionate way. She made an alteration to my medication to try and improve my mobility.  
Altogether, I felt much happier after the consultation.  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: conditionerqg75
title: Chaos into calm
body:
Our loved one has come to the end of a year long reduction programme. As a carer it holds a new space for us all. Chaos into calm, suffering into acceptance. We have looked on, loved and supported over many years. Love not judge has always held us together.  
I know we would not be in this place without the team in Gosport whom we have never met yet we trusted in, along with the process they enabled.  
Our loved one slipped through many nets and this space isn't for the analysis of that. So many wrong door experiences along the way. Inclusion didn't let our loved one slip through this time and we thank you for that.  
Thank you for sticking with our loved one who amazes us everyday. Addiction hides in solitude recovery thrives in community.  
Thank you.

title: Great practice
body: Great practice and Patches is very simple to use. However you must get online btwn 8 & 9 otherwise the site gets closed. Also if Patches is now the only method to get an appointment, it's extremely worrying for the elderly, which may not have online access.  We must ensure the older generation is not forgotten about

title: Poor interpersonal behaviour by surgeon
body: Leaving an unsatisfactory discussion with my son about my care, the surgeon said to the nurse accompanying him in a manner meant to be heard by my son " God, what do these people expect" . My son was tempted to reply ' civility and respect' but he bit his tongue.

title: Great practice
body: Can’t fault this practice. I had a short wait to see the Dr but that’s to be expected. Helpful friendly and efficient

title: Terrible service
body: More than once I have tried to make an appt with either doctor or nurse with no success at all. Absolutely dreadful

title: Timekeeping only applicable for patients not GPs
body:
I received a text message on 12th July from the surgery that I have a telephone appointment with the GP on the 19th July at 19.15.
I further received a reminder text on 18th July.
On the 19th July, Wednesday, I had prepared myself for the phone call readjusting my tutoring session to finish before 7pm, so that I will be available for the call at 7.15pm. I do tutoring sessions for a living.
At 6.34 pm, I received a call from a Private number, while I was teaching with a student. I cannot take personal phone calls while working, which would be unprofessional. There was a voicemail left that it is the doctor calling to check how I am doing and will call me back in 5 to 10 minutes. The lady doctor called me at 6.41pm. I couldn't take the call as I was still working. She left a voicemail that I should make another appointment.
I very well know how hard GPs work & that their schedules are full. But that does not mean that patients don't have a life and jobs to do. We are equally leading hectic lives like any GP juggling work, family & personal life. It would be nice if GPs can think of themselves as patients when they are unable to take calls from doctors who don't follow timings. 
Many thanks

title: Where are the receptionists ?
body:
Never anyone at reception all in back office. Waited 10 mins to give blood pressure results. Gave up in the end as I had children with me. Now using electronic check in. Where is the receptionists. 
Blood pressure machine no instructions at all. Lucky a lady in the waiting room told me what way to put my arm. It just needs a simple picture to tell people. 
Customer service zero. Doctors and nurses awesome though.

title: No aftercare
body: No communication or aftercare after the procedure. I am not happy with it and they are telling me i need to pay another £8k to do it again. Covid happened and they think they can use that as an excuse to say it was too long ago for them to be responsible. The Dr that did my surgery does not work for them anymore. Explains alot

title: Frustrating appointments system.
body: I have just tried to apply for a Drs appontment without success. Thankfully,  I very rarely need to see a Dr but in the instance I am feeling in need to do so. Using the totally frustating system to apply on line, I have only been able to access an appointment for a blood test, INR, whatever that  might be, or a specialist service outside a regular GP. I am reasonably computer literate but my husband also tried, without success. It has left me very apprehensive and anxious, for those in need of an early diagnosis for something serious, who may just give up as I have.....

author: septembercr89
title: Our Mum’s care following a stroke
body:
Mum was admitted to Winchester hospital - Twyford ward - following a stoke. We were given various promises about physio and ensuring she could walk, when she was discharged it was apparent this had not been the case. We were told she had capacity and could therefore refuse!  
We had specifically stated that she could be difficult and were happy to go in and work with the team - we were not asked! We also felt that we were being pushed to have a feedtube in her stomach but choose risk feeding. We felt she was messed around with this too as her water and food levels were changed with no reasons given often putting her backwards.  
When she was discharged we refused the 8 carers a day and has managed her care successfully on our own. She has physio at home and three weeks later is now able to walk and eat normal meals.  
We feel very frustrated and let down by the hospital as she could have been so much more independent had she been given the correct care. Since her discharge the support we have received has been far more specific to her needs and the results are showing.

readBy.name: Hampshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust / Virtual Wards

title: Frustrating service
body: When you try to book an appointment you have to wait about half an hour for reception to answer the call. You have to book weeks in advance - I have only managed to get telephone appointments - for the telephone appointments they don't give you a specific time so you have to have a whole afternoon free so you can take the call somewhere private. When you get your prescription they only give you one month's worth - even for contraception. If you send them a message on the app when you request your next prescription asking them to increase the quantity they ignore it. It probably works out cheaper to use an online doctor who will issue a bigger quantity rather than paying a lot every month. When you do speak to a clinician they are rushed and you feel like you are a chore.

title: Oaktree surgery, liskeard
body: Hard to get past the bouncer.... i mean, receptionist for an appointment. Even worse when getting a prescription from their dispensary. Ordered my repeats to be sent to my local boots store, to avoid the uselessness of the dispensary, only for them to decide to send it to their pensilva parter gp, and told me to collect from there (which is a 15min drive away, and I work full time!) No consideration for any of their patients. And rude when we want it sorted out! Always a massive queue. Seriously thinking of leaving.

title: Awful!
body: One of my family members came to A and E and it took them 9 hours to get her into a ward. They gave her 1 dose of pain relief within that time when she was in extreme pain and discomfort. Non of the nurses available helped as she asked a nurse for more anti sickness as she was throwing up a lot and they ignored her blatantly. I get that the nursed are all hard worked but it was a joke, expecially when we was there since 9 in the morning. Another incident was when my family member accessed the toilet and i asked a nurse to come help her politely, they said no and insisted they wasn’t going to come help. One lovely nurse came by and gave her the support she needed after 10 minutes of her waiting in the toilet by herself unattended. Id like to say thank you for that nurse and if i had a name i would disclose it as praise. I think the rest of it is an absolute joke and they didn’t take her infections she didn’t know about seriously.

title: Seeking information about long lost Aunty
body: I phoned the NHS published number for 15mins. I called 6 times because, although it was ringing out, it kept dropping out. As I was about to give up, the phone was answered by a young person, identifying as a care assistant.  They didn't know my Aunty, as they got her name muddled with someone else's. They said she was settling in well, but she's probably been there 2 decades. They worked downstairs, not upstairs, so they didn't know her. They went away to find someone who would know. After some time they said the nurse on the dementia ward was doing all the medication  I said that when I saw Aunty at her grandchilds wedding, many years ago, she was in a wheelchair and was taken back to Birch Green after the Church ceremony and did not stay for the family reception.  I observed, at that time, that Aunty appeared to have facial features and movements consistent with being medicated with neuroleptic antipsychotics. The care assistant wasn't able to comment on a resident's  medication.  I asked them to pop by and give Aunty a cup of tea from Valerie. I do care and I'm sorry that I have neglected Aunty. She was originally diagnosed with lupus and encouraged to go into the care home by medics and her husband. I'm pleased to have been given the name of the manager and best times to call tomorrow.  Maybe soon I will be able to visit the member of my family I loved being with most on family days out. She was very knd to me, as a small child and a lot of fun. Can someone ask if she remembers the rowing boat incident on the canal, falling in and wearing Valerie's tiny skirt home. We laughed such a lot. I wonder if she will smile. Thank you for allowing this review.

title: Poor Mri Department
body: I was referred by MSK,,, was told by someone that I have a appointment booked for 24 July 2023,,, now I am told that there is no appointment booked for me,,, what game is this department playing at,,, no one comes to the hospital for the fun of,,, they come because they have an issue,,, not to be played silly games..

author: Squish 23
title: Endoscopy unit
body: Excellent care by all involved in the endoscopy unit. Was kept informed throughout. Procedure explained clearly and opportunity to ask questions

title: I have been ignored
body: I applied to register as new patient in Feb 2023 and still no one has contacted me. The confirmation email said that it could be up to 2 weeks.

title: Excellent, professional friendly service
body: Happy to report that I was cared for by excellent, professional and friendly staff. Even though I've had an endoscopy several times before (in the south west, which weren't great) the team at Doncaster were efficient, understanding and kind. Couldn't have been any better. Many thanks from a rather claustrophobic patient. xx

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic care
body: I attended the urgent care centre after suffering with wheezing etc whilst on holiday. The staff at each stage were friendly, honest and knowledgeable and the entire process was very well organised and seamless. There was communication between each stage which saved time and the overall experience was very quick and had a positive outcome. I am very impressed and would definitely not think twice about using the service again if (hopefully not!) it was ever needed again. Thank you!

author: triangulumpe97
title: Shockingly Poor treatment
body:
I attended A&E with acute abdominal pains. I expected long waiting times, but did not expect what felt to me like an inhuman cattle market!  
I had to sit surrounded by other patients to receive my IV’s on a chair that was painful and actually exasperated my symptoms. It seemed like no one was afforded any dignity or privacy - I knew everyone’s name and dates of birth and ailments in my vicinity, as they knew mine!  
I eventually ground a doctor who, unlike the nurses, was not avoiding eye contact, to tell them my IV had finished. The doctor asked me to take a seat behind them and they'd get that sorted out. At this point, the nurse who had previously declined my request to move to a vacant and more comfortable seat pointed at me and asked why I was there. I explained I had asked for pain relief and was told that it’s not ideal, but my treatment is over, so I got my drip disconnected and taken - I felt very rudely - out of that area and into the waiting area again, in agony and tears. No pain relief.  
I am waiting for diagnosis and suspected appendicitis. If I need a surgery, I will not let these people anywhere near me with a scalpel! I feel my treatment has been brutal, inhumane, undignified and vulgar.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Terrible service
body: Arrived to be pushed out of a+e told go to different dept who will give treatment only to b told a+e do this all the time rather than treat people then moved on to another department having received no treatment and having to wait again 2 &a half hours no one even looked at my problem terrible wait times terrible treatment no one seems to care you are just pushed from dept to dept waiting for treatment a dog gets treatment quicker at the vets !!!!!!!!

title: Certainly would say Great practice
body:
Through patch got my appt same morning saw the doctor  who cared and asked in detail the problems and how poorly I was feeling 
Checked me and then suggested medication and assured me the medicine would work and if any problems arise I would be seen straight away
I feel much better now and I am sure the practice is keeping an eye on my health and improvements

Very pleased with Pinn medical surgery

title: Great practice nurses.
body: Very understanding and helpful, time to listen and good advice, nurse today was a locum 19th July 2023, absolutely brill standing in for also great nurses we have, wish I could name them!!.. thank you for your great help and service.

title: Rude curt and ill mannered staff
body: Absolutely shocking behaviour by nursing staff. I tried to raise a safeguarding concern and the sister in charge was so rude and unprofessional. She wanted me to disclose sensitive information on the main desk and I had to ask for a private space. She then rushed me as I tried to explain my concerned and interrupted me and when I asked her to please wait and let me explain she accused me of being aggressive. I felt distressed and that my concerns were not taken seriously. She made me feel I was keeping her from her work. Her behaviour was upsetting.

author: Blooddonor79
title: Amazing staff
body:
I attended at the blood donor centre in Aberdeen and was going through initial checks with the donor carer (Uma) and I stated I had a problem with my previous donation and I suffered some bruising due to some trauma on the vein.  
Uma went over and above to reassure me, talked to other carers and nurses to state what happened before and continually gave reassuring smiles throughout my donation. I have always had kind and friendly service at the Aberdeen donor centre but today Uma, Rhoda and Betty were amazing!!

author: aurigaxd65
title: Such friendly,caring, yet professional staff
body: I was talked through every step of my appointment today, from the initial booking, to reception and into the clinic, nothing was too much trouble for anyone, such friendly,caring, yet professional staff. Thank you again ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

title: Fantastic care
body: Had gallbladder surgery on Sunday I was so nervous and stressed and every single member of staff really looked after me and got me through it. I received excellent care and my nurse was so lovely.

title: Terrible experience overall
body:
My waters broke at 36+2 weeks, the dr I saw at MAU first didn't believe me but changed his mind after scanning me, I was kept on the ward overnight and sent home the next day as labour had not progressed. I was back a day later with regular contractions. After a few hours waiting at MAU I was told my baby had a reduced heartrate and was told I would be taken to labour and delivery to be induced as I still wasn't progressing. The midwives changed shifts and I was forgotten about untill I asked what was happening hours later, the senior midwife said I wasn't contracting enough so why on earth would they send me to labour and delivery. When I asked if she had any handover notes she said she would have to find them, suggesting they hadn't been read in the first place. I was then told I couldn't go to labour and delivery as they were too busy and my baby's heart rate had stabilised, I would have to go back to the ward overnight. This was after being there for 10 hours, with no offer of food and rarely offered water unless I asked.

The next morning I was put on the ward with women who had given birth already, eventually left by myself when they were moved on to postnatal, my requests for pain relief or any help in the early hours were met with a lack of compassion that made me feel like I was being a pain. When I told I would have to wait a couple of hours for more paracetamol and then being upset as it wasn't helping I was told by the midwife and I quote "You don't have to be a martyr, you can have some pethidine". As a first time Mum I had no idea what pain relief I could have, and felt upset that I was being spoken to like I was just trying to be difficult. The midwife didn't return to give any more pain relief. I was finally taken to labour and delivery to be induced 5 days after my waters had gone. My baby ended up in NICU due to suspectdd sepsis and low blood sugar, when upset about this on the ward, I could hear the young midwives at the desk nearby ridiculing me for being so upset. Going back there to have a baby in the future is my worst nightmare, the thought of even stepping foot back in the building makes me anxious.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Paramedics went above and beyond
body:
The two paramedics who took me to hospital went above and beyond to support myself and my mum during a very difficult time. They showed professionalism, humanity and compassion. Despite it being the end of their long shift they showed humour and treated me with dignity and respect throughout. 
I am unable to write names here - but if possible I would love to contact someone to pass on my admiration of such strong wonderful people who remind us that even with everything going on in the world right now, there are still kind souls out there.

title: Great patient care
body: I was admitted as an emergency treated with great care and compassion. Treatment was excellent. I was transferred to a cardiac ward, where I received excellent treatment, care and compassion again, for nine days until I was fit enough to go home. Aftercare was arranged. Thank you all so much for saving my life and getting me back to health.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Get appointment bad
body: I've nerve damage and for the life of me I cant get an appointment my ability to walk is poor and the constant pain is really bad cant sleep because of it that's all I get from the receptionist is ring back just need a appointment

title: Service
body: I came to hisptil just to clean my eye it's just basicly wash which took max 10 min and I waiting 6h how it's possible people which paying taxis and paying every time 100euro have to vait so long even when it's no people in waiting room it's diskraisfull health care

author: Linds2903
title: Lovely and reassuring
body:
I had a mole that appeared and grew quickly on my nose. I went to the GP and was seen by the nurse who referred me to dermatology as the growth was so quick and a hard skin kept growing over it. I was seen by dermatology within 3 months and they were very helpful and reassuring and referred me to get it removed and sent away.  
I got another appointment within 3 months. On the day I was very nervous and the nurses Kirsty and Laura who were removing the mole were brilliant. Kirsty explained everything to me in depth and made sure I understood the full procedure and what would happen and any aftercare. Laura was so lovely and reassuring and chatted away to me which definitely helped my nerves. As Kirsty was doing the procedure she explained each step and let me know what was going to happen before doing it, which was so good.  
As uncomfortable and nerve wracking as the procedure was, Kirsty and Laura made such a difference with how they took care of me throughout. Thank you.

author: delphinusbt48
title: Great birth experience
body:
I was very lucky to experience a wonderful birth at the CMU in the RAH. I was very disappointed as I was hoping for a home birth but wasn’t able to due to staff shortage over the weekend. However I was incredibly lucky to have a great experience in hospital!  
The main factor I was worried about was being in water and I was very lucky as I was able to use the pool. This made a huge difference to me as I’ve birthed successfully in water before so knowing I’d have this made me much more at ease. As I arrived the midwives warmly welcomed us, they had made the room BEAUTIFUL with fairy lights ect, the pool was drawn and music playing! I felt so at ease, fortunately I birthed in the pool not much later.  
My main midwife present was Rhona and she was just wonderful; experienced, professional, kind, caring and hardworking. Above and beyond doesn’t cut it. Megan and Gemma were midwives who were around as well who were absolutely amazing also! We’re just so impressed and they made being in hospital actually really lovely!  
There were times during my pregnancy that I called the unit and the midwives were highly professional and helpful on the phone. If I may suggest, it would be lovely if they had introduced themselves by name on the phone. There were times I only found out who it was by the end of the call because I asked and it turned out we had met in the past. Of course I don’t expect to be remembered as you all have so many women you care for. But for me it is highly encouraging and reassuring when I talk to a midwife I have already got a rapport with and know to be lovely, so it helps a lot when I knew who it was I was speaking to. :)I’m very sorry I can’t remember any names but I was made to feel very comfortable and at ease in day care when I was 2 weeks over due and very sad and grumpy about not being in labour! The midwives, receptionist and the registrar were awesome! Thank you to all you hardworking folk in maternity!

title: The most amazing midwives and nurses
body: This was the second time I chose to give birth at Northwick Park  hospital and I had the most amazing nurses, midwives and doctors.I can't thank them enough for what they did. Overall I had a great experience. I would 100% recommend anyone to Northwick Park hospital.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Reception
body: Mum went to surgery to get Hol vacination,only to be told By a rude receptionist, that she can’t be vaccinated until 6 weeks,mum did explain she leaves in august and it would be enough time,receptionist  did not listen,,mum panicked and went to boots,paid for vacination with money that she had to borrow,,,

title: Incredible Doctor!!
body: I have generally had good GP experiences, however, today I had one of the most comprehensive and genuinely patient-forward follow-up calls from a doctor that I have had in years. It’s a shame that I cannot name this person, but anybody who has had the pleasure of their consultation knows exactly who I mean! Throughout my call I felt they were present and actively listened to my concerns. Their feedback and follow up recommendations made me feel like my health and wellness was their #1 priority.  I wish there were more doctors like this who gave this level of attention and care about their parents well-being. Amazing!!!

title: Exceptional
body: I had knee replacement surgery and found all the staff from cleaners to operating staff outstanding. All very kind and caring nothing was too much trouble. I desperately wanted to go home the same day and it was looking unlikely as I had to have a x-ray and the pharmacy was closing I hadn't got my meds. The staff went above and beyond to make it happen and managed to get me ready to go home by 8.00pm. Thank you all so much. I absolutely recommended the orthopaedic department and couldn't have had a better experience.

title: Great service
body: Two Fabulous ladies attended our 94 year old neighbour who had fallen and cut his head badly. They were friendly, reassuring and extremely professional, a credit to the service.

author: lcrf
title: Our experience has been overall positive
body:
On behalf of my family, I’d like to mention and thank the staff of these 3 areas for the care my mum has received, (in very difficult circumstances), over the past few weeks.  
In particular, Elaine and Gillian from the CP Care of the older people, who have been exceptional in care delivery and support of us all. I am very grateful, girls. Our experience has been overall positive, in extremely busy areas within the VHK.  
Unfortunately, my mum's belongings were lost during transfer between AAU1 and Ward 32, which was disappointing as people’s property is important to them.

author: Billy bronco
title: Top class care
body:
My partner had reservations about going into the Bellfield centre till she was in it. She was told it was virtually an old folks home, and that it was just a bunch of carers looking after older people.  
Well my partner did get her eyes opened and myself also. Being curious we had a wee peek about what to expect, and Googled the Bellfield and told her to beware what was about to unfold.  
All the staff who worked around my partner were wonderful, with a few exceptions. Moving on, the room was well laid out and spotless. The food was to a very agreeable standard - of course I tasted plenty of it! The care she got was very over the top to a certain degree but it was all well done and made my partner and I very happy.  
I will close very shortly but I must applaud a few people. Maria, top class, Michelle, brilliant, Angela ditto and all others who looked after my partner, and me. So here ends the story but wait I forgot about Jason, what a guy he is. He went over and above to help not just my partner but everybody in his care.  
Again, many thanks.

author: JP.
title: Looking forward to the future.
body:
I started with Inclusion Thurrock in February with my therapist, Kim. I suffered with GAD (generalised anxiety disorder) and I didn’t know how to cope/resolve it.  
Kim has helped me changed my life around. I have be able to do more things now without getting anxious then I would have ever imagined by Kim changing my thought process on how I look at every situation. She was respectful throughout our sessions and I really felt like she cared about helping me resolve my issues.  
We set home practice tasks to do every week which gave me the confidence to be able to realise I could do new things and push myself out of my comfort zone. This really has been the best thing I have done to improve my quality of life.  
I can now look forward to the future.

author: Johyq45
title: A long awaited endoscopy!
body:
This is not a story about how long it took to take place. Things happen and folk within the NHS have struggled with unexpected pressures for some 3 years now.  
In September 2022 I started suffering difficulties with eating a good meal. I found that I was unable to finish a meal and had to be sick to relieve the agony. A visit to my GP resulted in a referral to carry out an examination by endoscopy for which I received an acknowledgement in October.  
I was delighted to get a phone call recently inviting me for the endoscopy this week. The event was carried out with careful professionalism and care with no sense of being rushed. The result? I've got a hiatus hernia which although unpleasant can be easily medicated.  
Brilliant, even if I did have to wait!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: earthcw45
title: Poor parking advice
body:
Whilst attending The Beatson for radiotherapy treatment my wife and I arrived with 30 minutes before my appointment. After driving around trying to find a space and getting closer and closer to appointment time I spoke to a parking attendant. They instructed us to take any space available including disabled or staff only parking. With this advice I parked in a marked disabled space, something I have never done in my life even now with quite debilitating osteoarthritis. We came out to a parking ticket which obviously made me upset.  
I completely understand the need for managed parking on a very busy but very restricted site however people are attending for life saving treatment and to come out to a ticket AFTER being advised by a parking attendant to park basically anywhere was upsetting and maddening.  
I observed many vehicles with tickets on my exit and find this practice extremely frustrating as with very limited parking at an extremely busy hospital people feel pressured to park and get in for treatment.  
Taking all this into consideration and being treated for cancer I object strongly to this ticket and will not be paying it. I have to say I find it greatly disturbing that NHSGG use a London based company to enforce parking with all the revelations over the last few years of unscrupulous parking firms.

author: C section mum
title: Parent sleep arrangements
body:
At 5 days post-C section my son was admitted to Maynard for jaundice, I had just had my staples removed this same afternoon. The ward has no space available for parents to have a day bed or even a recliner, all that is available is a hard tall back chair. This is not adequate to sleep in, especially for post partum mothers. I was extremely uncomfortable all night and spent the whole night awake sitting in pain or standing, unable to follow the medical advice I was given to recover.  
My son is exclusively breast fed, so leaving his side was not an option and wouldn't of been had he of been bottle fed either as he was 5 days old and it's crucial for our bond to be together. The staff overnight were apologetic about the unfortunate situation I found myself in, but were totally unable to offer any kind of solution.  
The following morning I was in agony, luckily baby's dad was here to keep an eye on me as I was passing out, sitting in the chair and almost hitting the floor. My wound had started to ooze overnight from sitting so long, unable to lie down and air it out as advised by maternity staff, the amazing nurse on the following day really went above and beyond to try and find some sort of solution as they could see physically the effect the situation was having on me.  
I shared my concerns of my wound and upon showing the nurse they contacted EOU in maternity for me and I went there, which was so busy I then had to walk all the way back to feed my son again and then back to EOU again when they where available to see me. The Dr in EOU reiterated that I needed to lie down and thankfully the nurse had managed to get a free bed space beside my son that I've been able to lie down and rest in. This is only available as the bed was not currently needed, so by complete luck and the nurse's kindness.  
I think this needs to be seriously looked into, there are parents on this ward who have been staying in a chair for the past 6 nights! Who are having to sleep unsafely in the same bed with their small children so they are able to sleep to function and care for them properly.  
I've spoken to other parents, and the number of them found in this position is just unacceptable, in my opinion. Parents literally are sleeping on the floor to try to get some sort of rest. As parents we need to be able to rest, especially at a time when our children are most vulnerable, we are their advocates and decision makers!  
Due to this situation I have found my self totally exhausted, back on multiple pain killers with an oozing wound and an antibiotic prescription, unable to care for my beautiful new born son on my own and having to pump to allow dad to feed our son as I physically am not well enough. I'm extremely lucky to have a partner that is here to help me, I dread to think of how much worse the situation would be if I was also a single parent.  
I've been admitted to the Royal children's with my daughter previously and was always offered a day bed for admissions, and even a recliner in A&E.  
I feel like things need to change!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: greenxd84
title: Failing system
body:
3 years of going round in circles, the inability to provide the correct support and treatment surrounding OCD. The root cause - when you speak to ones who do care, is said to be funding; the lack of resources prevent them from going down the correct avenue. This seems to lead to a lack of engagement and want to help.  
My family have suffered, my dad continues to get worse. My teenage sister who lives with my dad now has poor mental health as a result of daily exposure to my dad's worsening condition. I find the Psychiatrist to be arrogant, fails to listen, is dismissive and has an opinion that cannot be changed. You have good people within your system. But your system is failing them, it's failing my sister and my dad.

author: Kranthikumar621
title: Exercise classes are helpful
body: Following a heart attack, I attended an exercise class let by physio Abbi. Feel better now, exercise classes are helpful

author: papajy36
title: Believing you can beat the demon inside you.
body:
On the way down on the train I felt anxious and full of nerves. As soon as I crossed the threshold I was made to feel welcome and put straight away at ease. The staff go beyond the call of duty - they are so friendly, helpful, always there to listen to you, put a smile back on your face and give you the belief you can beat the demon inside you.  
The facilities are second to none and the food is superb.  
I couldn't recommend Dame Carol highly enough.

author: MatthewB
title: Rushcliffe CMHT
body:
I have been under the CMHT since around June 2022, this is when I was assessed as needing support following my former CPN in Leicestershire trying to transfer my case.  
It was recommended that I see a staff member who is training to be a counsellor. They were supposed to give me counselling sessions to process the trauma I had been through in my life and develop strategies to improve my management of my mental health condition.  
There have been a total of 29 arranged appointments, they have cancelled 16. 7 weeks in a row the moment with no communication from the CMHT since the end of May. I understand the worker is off sick, I have been told to call the duty worker but whenever I call nobody answers and I do not feel a therapist can be replaced with an unknown duty worker who isn’t a therapist or training to be one.  
I would like to be assessed by a psychologist as I feel my mental health condition is worse than the CMHT believes it to be. My GP told me I need to speak to the CMHT but I don’t have anyone overseeing my care or aware of who I would speak to, in other counties I’ve had a consultant who I could discus’s medications and these types of requests with.  
My mental health has taken a sharp decline and I’ve had active suicidal thoughts and plans  
My GP has given me a sick note from work for 4 weeks but I do not feel any better after 2 weeks off.  
The work with the CMHT has bought all my trauma to the surface but due to inconsistencies in appointments, lack of knowledge by the worker and cancelled appointments - I feel I have been left in a worse place than when I started and now I feel like absolute rubbish.  
I spent a very long time being abused everyday for 11 years, I just want help to process that and how to live a healthier life than I have since I escaped it.

author: NB367
title: Made to feel incredibly comfortable and safe
body:
The whole staff on Bassett Ward have made me feel incredibly comfortable and safe. It’s been a very positive journey over the last 2 weeks. All the staff were very supportive and helpful. The students were very knowledgeable and absolutely lovely. I couldn’t have asked for a better experience or better care from all the staff.  
The staff are the reason I was able to have my baby via vbac rather than repeat c-section. Without the support and care of the staff I would have had a C-section again, they truly made his birth possible and when things got scary when he was born the whole team on Labour ward were quick on their feet and made sure that my little boy was okay.  
I will never be able to thank the staff involved in both of our care enough for everything they have done for us in the 2 weeks I spent on Bassett Ward.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Hummi
title: Relaxed development review.
body:
I came to visit the EYW for my son's development review. I was met and greeted by Georgina. She is an amazing lady who made me and my son feel comfortable. She was so easy going and relaxed.  
Love her so much and made my day wonderful.

author: Julzg75
title: Really happy with the service
body:
I contacted the advice line after having some concerns about my young daughter’s most recent bout of stuttering and also to get some advice regarding the night time potty training process.  
Ali was amazingly supportive about my concerns. I felt listened to and she offered helpful evidence-based advice and signposted me to a couple of websites for further help and support too. She showed concern and was able to arrange a referral for my daughter’s stuttering and followed up with an email the next day regarding the issues we had spoken about during our call.  
Really happy with the service, thank you so much for your support and guidance!

author: Kaodorite
title: I really felt cared for
body: I had my minor op recently at Cannock Hospital. The whole staff on that ward was excellent, from checking in to being discharged, all cheerfully and full of smiles, I really felt cared for. My nurse, Lara, was lovely and caring, always making sure I was OK. Can only praise them all.

author: madperson
title: Crisis care at night
body:
I have complained so many times and nothing is getting better  
This time a response of-we know it’s not working and we need to improve things-is just not going to cut it  
So many times I ring when I am distressed at night and no one answers the phone. To then be bombarded with leave your name, date of birth, telephone number and the team you are open to is just too overwhelming when you are distressed  
I rang so many times during the night last night and couldn’t leave a message. Finally just after 5am I left what I know was a clear message asking for someone to ring me  
I was struggling and feeling suicidal. I had hurt myself during a mental health crisis and needed help  
I felt reassured that I had finally been able to leave a message and trusted that someone would ring me and I could get the help I needed  
However, as is very normal recently no one rang me back and I am now sat outside the hospital trying to find the courage to go in and get some help  
If there is no support at night why not just be honest and say so and I won’t spend hours waiting for help that never comes  
This is putting my life at risk and I need to get something resolved as quickly as possible

author: MrMohumed13
title: Supported to achieve my goals
body:
I had 3 stents done and was referred to service.  
I was seen by nurse Chika nurse and physio Abi in clinic, after that I was seen in Abi's exercise class at KRCC.  
I was supported by Abi in the exercise class and shown what to do. I had to pass the fitness test to be able to return to work. With the help of physio and the team I am now able to practice!  
Thanks to cardiac rehabilitation services, nurses and especially Physio Abi for the phone calls onward, referral advice, mental and physical support to make me achieve my goals.  
To Chika, the nurses and Abi physio exercise team, thank you !

author: LadyEng
title: Deserves the highest accolades
body:
I cannot praise the Breast Care Centre enough. It is the jewel in the crown of NHS, in my view.  
I have been diagnosed and treated there twice for breast cancer - both times the service has been superlative. The first time my treatment was lumpectomy, sentinel node biopsy, and radiotherapy. More recently mastectomy and lymph node biopsy.  
From friendly receptionists to exceptionally supportive nursing staff and reassuringly competent specialists, I don't think I could have received better in the private sector. This place deserves the highest accolades.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The hospital has been very good so far
body: The hospital has been very good so far to be honest. It's been very clean so far, everything is kept in pretty good order. It's also nice how well signed everything is. It was easy to find 2 south, which is where I'm visiting my mother. Here care has been good and I appreciate everything the staff have done for my mother.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Sharp Elbows
title: Their professionalism, team working, and care are a credit to the NHS
body:
From the outset everyone who spoke to me kept me informed and reassured. I came with concerns about the outcome, but the whole procedure gave me confidence that I was well looked after. During the procedure the staff kept me at my ease the while time. There was plenty of banter, too, which suited me just fine.  
I thank the whole team, from the nurse who carried out the colonoscopy, to the nurse who walked me back to reception. Their professionalism, team working , and care are a credit to the NHS.

author: Flo831
title: Can’t thank everyone enough for all care during my stay
body:
Recently admitted to CAU with possible sepsis, then transferred to Station 9.  
Can’t thank everyone enough for all care during my stay. This wasn’t just the doctors and nurses but includes portering staff (I had loads of tests) domestic services teams (fab chats!!) and pharmacy staff.  
I had wonderful care and listening teams. I’d also like to thank catering teams as meals were great. I wasn’t going home without having my lunch.  
I’m in the middle of having longer term Glasgow treatment and this was a glitch I didn’t need, but they all helped me through it with positivity  
Please pass on my thanks to all involved.

author: Brady734
title: Amazing care, friendship and professionalism
body:
After my husband had another stroke recently, and a week in the Victoria Hospital, he was transferred to Letham Ward at Cameron Hospital for Physio.  
Relatives are quick to complain but are rather slow in giving compliments when due, so my husband and I would like you to know how very grateful I am for my husband's care in Letham Ward.  
Shirley has an amazing team within her ward, and I would like them to be recognised for their amazing care, friendship and professionalism.
